traffic signs.description: A red, circular sign with the number "40" on it indicates that there is a speed limit ahead, placed on the right side of the road.
traffic signs.explanation: This sign alerts drivers that they are approaching a speed limit and should prepare to adjust their speed.

traffic cones.description: Several traffic cones are placed diagonally on the lane leading to the right.
traffic cones.explanation: These cone-shaped signs indicate a no-driving zone; vehicles must avoid this area and continue to drive safely by following the existing lane markings.

barriers.description: Temporary barriers and traffic cones are set up together to reinforce lane merging or closure.
barriers.explanation: Obstacle-assistive traffic cones indicate that a portion of the road is not accessible.

other objects.description: The water droplets on the windshield suggest that it has rained.
other objects.explanation: Rainy weather can reduce visibility, and it may be necessary to use windshield wipers and reduce speed to maintain visibility and safety.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic scene presented, there are no vehicles or vulnerable road users present. However, there is a traffic sign that is of particular significance: it's a red, circular sign with the number "40" on it, positioned on the right side of the road, indicating that there's a speed limit ahead. Drivers are being alerted to prepare to reduce their speed appropriately.

Additionally, there are several traffic cones placed diagonally on the lane that leads to the right. These are indicating that the particular section of the lane is not meant to be driven on and that vehicles should continue by following the customary lane markings to ensure safety.

Temporary barriers also accompany the traffic cones, underlining that a part of the road is inaccessible. These barriers guide vehicles toward lane merging or signal the closure of a lane.

Lastly, there are signs of recent weather conditions, as evidenced by water droplets on the windshield, suggesting it has just rained. This serves as a reminder that visibility may be reduced due to wet conditions, and drivers may need to engage their windshield wipers and drive at reduced speeds to maintain visibility and safety.

driving_suggestion: Due to the wet road surface, the vehicle should maintain a moderate speed and be prepared to go straight or turn right at the upcoming intersection or road section. Traffic cones indicate that the right portion of the lane is prohibited from use. The vehicle also needs to pay attention to any additional signs or signals that may be present due to temporary road conditions caused by temporary construction. There are no vehicles and vulnerable road users in the current path, indicating that the road ahead is clear, but it is necessary to continuously monitor the surrounding environment to respond to any dynamic changes. Adjust the headlights and windshield wipers as needed to ensure optimal visibility.

1.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, typically used to signal that part of the road is closed off for construction, an accident, or other temporary hazards. It guides the ego car's driver to adjust their path and avoid the indicated area, maintaining a safe distance from potential dangers or obstructions.

2.description and explanation: This is a traffic sign indicating leftward movement, typically informing the driver of the ego car about upcoming road changes or routes. It should influence the driver to be prepared to follow the direction indicated if that is their intended route, or to choose an appropriate lane if they intend to go straight or turn right.
